properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 4 at 2:31AM MST until January 4 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow and blowing snow developing. Total snow
accumulations of 1 to 3 inches at lower elevations west of an
East Glacier to Babb line, and 3 to 6 inches at Marias Pass.
Winds gusting as high as 90 mph.

* WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front, generally along and
west of an East Glacier to Babb line. This advisory does not
include the City of Browning.

* WHEN...From 3 AM to 9 PM MST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Widespread blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST THIS EVENING
